ground_truth: He lies on top of Fantine, and her lips tremble. Once finished, he gets off her and saunters away, leaving her on her back. She lies motionless, her head on a pillow. Her rouged face is grim and somber. Fantine looks miserable. She breathes quickly and swallows. Her shoulders heave. She sits up. Her once clear skin is blotchy and smeared with dirt. She strokes her short cropped hair. Her cheeks streaked with tears, Fantine glances behind her. Her expression is solemn. Night in the slum. A punter to a pimp. A smartly-dressed man takes off his hat and grabs Fantine's dress. He presses himself on her. She scratches his face. He pushes her away as Javert approaches. Fantine recognizes Valjean and moves away. She turns her back to him. She breathes rapidly. He recoils as she spits in his face. Javert raises a hand to hold back one of his men. He picks her up in his arms. Javert watches them go. Javert is handed a letter. Standing outside in the snow, Javert opens the letter and reads it. He glances up and screws up the letter. He stands in front of Valjean. His brow furrowed, Valjean gets to his feet. Valjean sits back down at his desk. Javert looks puzzled, then bows curtly and takes his leave. Valjean watches him go, then leans on his desk. In church, he kneels at an altar. He packs money and papers into a case. He takes a carriage to court. They stare at him as the court usher escorts him out. At the hospital, a nurse tends to Fantine, who lies on her back. The nurse dabs her semiconscious patient's forehead with a cloth, then rises and walks out of the room. Valjean enters. An image of the nine-year-old blonde girl. The image has vanished. Fantine becomes still, and her head lulls to one side. Valjean closes her lifeless eyes. He bends forward and kisses her on the temple. Javert draws his sword. Having fended Javert off with a baton torn from the wall, Valjean is disarmed. He but turns, rushes out of the door, and dives into the river below. Javert runs out, but there's no sign of Valjean. Fantine lies at peace in the hospital bed. Cosette, young and grubby, is at the inn. She looks out enviously at children playing in the snow. Cosette glares. A pretty little girl. At the inn, Thenardier hauls himself to his feet and wanders past his subtle clientele. He gives a staggering bloke a drink. A silver-haired gent. He takes the man's reading glasses. His wife messes a soldier's jacket. She gazes at the handsome man. Outside along on a crate by a mule.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: He lies on Fantine, her lips trembling. Finished, he saunters away, leaving her motionless with a grim, somber face. Fantine looks miserable, breathing quickly and swallowing. Her shoulders heave as she sits up, her once clear skin now blotchy and dirty. She strokes her short hair, her cheeks streaked with tears, and glances back solemnly. Night in the slum. A punter approaches a pimp. A smartly-dressed man removes his hat and grabs Fantine's dress, pressing on her. She scratches his face, and he pushes her away as Javert approaches. Fantine recognizes Valjean, turns away, and spits in his face. Javert holds back his men and picks her up. Javert receives a letter, reads it outside in the snow, then crumples it. He stands before Valjean, who rises, then sits back at his desk. Javert, puzzled, bows and leaves. Valjean watches, then leans on his desk. In church, he kneels at an altar, packs money and papers into a case, and takes a carriage to court. The court usher escorts him out. At the hospital, a nurse tends to Fantine, dabbing her forehead before leaving. Valjean enters. An image of a nine-year-old blonde girl vanishes. Fantine becomes still, her head lulling to one side. Valjean closes her lifeless eyes, kisses her temple. Javert draws his sword. Valjean fends him off with a baton, then dives into the river. Javert runs out, but Valjean is gone. Fantine lies at peace. Cosette, young and grubby, is at the inn, enviously watching children play in the snow. Cosette glares. A pretty little girl. Thenardier hauls himself up, wandering past clientele, giving a staggering bloke a drink. A silver-haired gent. He takes the man's reading glasses. His wife messes with a soldier's jacket, gazing at the handsome man outside on a crate by a mule.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: He lies sprawled on top of Fantine, and her lips begin to tremble with emotion. Once he has finished, he casually gets off her and saunters away, leaving her lying on her back. She remains motionless, her head resting on a pillow. Her face, heavily rouged, appears grim and somber. Fantine looks utterly miserable. She breathes quickly, swallowing hard. Her shoulders heave with each breath. Slowly, she sits up. Her once clear and smooth skin is now blotchy and smeared with dirt. She gently strokes her short, cropped hair. Her cheeks, streaked with tears, reflect her sorrow as Fantine glances behind her. Her expression is solemn and full of despair. It is night in the slum. A punter approaches a pimp. A smartly-dressed man, with an air of arrogance, takes off his hat and grabs Fantine's dress. He presses himself against her. In response, she scratches his face. He angrily pushes her away just as Javert approaches. Fantine recognizes Valjean and instinctively moves away. She turns her back to him, breathing rapidly. He recoils as she defiantly spits in his face. Javert raises a hand to hold back one of his men. He then picks her up in his arms. Javert watches them go, his eyes following their departure. Javert is handed a letter. Standing outside in the falling snow, Javert opens the letter and reads it carefully. He glances up, then crumples the letter in his hand. He stands in front of Valjean, his brow furrowed with thought. Valjean gets to his feet, then sits back down at his desk. Javert looks puzzled, then bows curtly and takes his leave. Valjean watches him go, then leans heavily on his desk. In the quiet of the church, he kneels at an altar. He packs money and important papers into a case. He takes a carriage to the court. They stare at him as the court usher escorts him out. At the hospital, a nurse tends to Fantine, who lies on her back. The nurse gently dabs her semiconscious patient's forehead with a cloth, then rises and walks out of the room. Valjean enters quietly. An image of the nine-year-old blonde girl appears in his mind. The image has vanished. Fantine becomes still, and her head lulls to one side. Valjean tenderly closes her lifeless eyes. He bends forward and kisses her gently on the temple. Javert draws his sword with determination. Having fended Javert off with a baton torn from the wall, Valjean is eventually disarmed. But he turns, rushes out of the door, and dives into the river below. Javert runs out, but there is no sign of Valjean. Fantine lies at peace in the hospital bed. Cosette, young and grubby, is at the inn. She looks out enviously at children playing joyfully in the snow. Cosette glares, her eyes filled with longing. A pretty little girl. At the inn, Thenardier hauls himself to his feet and wanders past his subtle clientele. He gives a staggering bloke a drink. A silver-haired gentleman. He takes the man's reading glasses. His wife messes with a soldier's jacket. She gazes admiringly at the handsome man. Outside, alone on a crate by a mule.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: He finds himself sprawled leisurely atop Fantine, and soon, her lips begin to tremble with a rush of raw emotion. Once he concludes, he nonchalantly rises from her and saunters away, leaving her lying desolate and alone on her back. She remains utterly motionless, with her head gently resting on a well-worn pillow. Her face, heavily rouged to the point of excess, appears grim and somber. It is clear that Fantine looks utterly miserable. She breathes quickly, each inhalation a laborious task as she swallows hard. Her shoulders heave noticeably with each shallow breath. Slowly and with visible difficulty, she sits up. Her once clear and smooth skin is now blotchy and smeared with dirt, showing signs of her hardships. Gently, she strokes her short, cropped hair with a sense of longing. Her cheeks, streaked with tears, reflect the deep sorrow she feels as Fantine glances behind her. Her expression remains solemn, full of despair and resignation. It is night in the slum, casting a shadowy darkness over the scene. A punter approaches a pimp with an air of intent. A smartly-dressed man, exuding an air of arrogance, takes off his hat and grabs Fantine's dress without hesitation. He brazenly presses himself against her, causing her to respond instinctively by scratching his face in defense. Angrily, he pushes her away, just as Javert approaches the scene. Fantine recognizes Valjean instinctively and moves away with caution. She turns her back to him, breathing rapidly and with a sense of urgency. He recoils momentarily when she defiantly spits in his face. Javert raises a hand to signal his men to hold back. He then takes a gentle step forward and picks her up in his arms, as Javert watches them go, his eyes following their departure with intent. Javert is handed a letter, and standing solemnly outside in the softly falling snow, he opens the letter and reads it carefully. He glances up briefly, then crumples the letter tightly in his hand. Standing in front of Valjean, his brow furrows with deep thought. Valjean gets to his feet with effort, then sits back down at his desk, pondering. Javert appears puzzled, then bows curtly and takes his leave with a sense of purpose. Valjean watches him as he goes, then leans heavily on his desk, deep in thought. In the stillness of the quiet church, he kneels reverently at an altar. He carefully packs money and important papers into a case with deft hands. Taking a carriage, he heads to the court, where they stare curiously at him as the court usher escorts him out. At the hospital, a nurse attentively tends to Fantine, who lies on her back in a state of vulnerability. The nurse gently dabs the forehead of her semiconscious patient with a soft cloth, then rises quietly and walks out of the room. Valjean enters softly. An image of the nine-year-old blonde girl appears fleetingly in his mind. The poignant image vanishes. Fantine becomes still, and her head gently lulls to one side. Valjean tenderly closes her lifeless eyes with a sense of deep loss. He bends forward slowly and kisses her gently on the temple, a final goodbye. With determination, Javert draws his sword. Having fended Javert off with a makeshift baton torn from the wall, Valjean is eventually disarmed. But he turns with swift resolve, rushes out of the door, and dives with urgency into the river below. Javert runs out after him, but there is no sign of Valjean. Fantine lies at peace in the hospital bed, a serene stillness in the air. Cosette, young and grubby, remains at the inn. She looks out longingly at children playing joyfully in the snow. Cosette glares through the window, her eyes filled with a longing and wistful envy. A pretty little girl in a world that seems far away. At the inn, Thenardier hauls himself to his feet and wanders past his subtle clientele with a deliberate pace. He gives a staggering bloke a drink, a gesture executed with practiced ease. A silver-haired gentleman stands nearby. He takes the man's reading glasses with a deft hand. His wife fusses over a soldier's jacket with admiration. She gazes admiringly at the handsome man, lost in her thoughts, while outside, she sits alone on a crate by a tired mule.

Valjean watches him go, then leans on his desk in contemplation. In a church, he kneels at an altar, then packs money and papers into a case. Fantine becomes still, her head lulling to one side, and Valjean tenderly closes her lifeless eyes. He bends forward and kisses her gently on the temple. Javert draws his sword, and after fending Javert off with a baton torn from the wall, Valjean is disarmed. He quickly turns, rushes out of the door, and dives into the river below. Javert runs out, but finds no sign of Valjean. Fantine lies at peace in the hospital bed. Meanwhile, Cosette, young and grubby, is at the inn, looking out enviously at children playing in the snow. Cosette glares, observing a pretty little girl. At the inn, Thenardier hauls himself to his feet and wanders past his subtle clientele, giving a staggering bloke a drink. A silver-haired gentleman takes the man's reading glasses, while his wife messes with a soldier's jacket, gazing at the handsome man outside along on a crate by a mule.

Fantine, motionless with a rouged face, breathes quickly and swallows, her skin blotchy and smeared with dirt. She sits up, strokes her short hair, and glances solemnly behind her. Thenardier, at the inn, interacts with his clientele, taking a man's reading glasses and observing his wife with a soldier outside.

Fantine looks miserable, reflecting the harsh realities faced by many women of her time. She breathes quickly and swallows. Her shoulders heave. She sits up. Her once clear skin is blotchy and smeared with dirt from the squalid living conditions she endures. She strokes her short cropped hair, a sacrifice she made to provide for her child. Her cheeks streaked with tears, Fantine glances behind her. Her expression is solemn. Night in the slum, a dangerous place filled with desperation. A punter, a common term for a client of prostitutes, to a pimp. A smartly-dressed man, likely a wealthier client, takes off his hat and grabs Fantine's dress. He presses himself on her. She scratches his face. He pushes her away as Javert, the rigid and duty-bound police inspector, approaches. Fantine recognizes Valjean, the man she once trusted, and moves away. She turns her back to him. She breathes rapidly. He recoils as she spits in his face, her anger and bitterness evident. Javert raises a hand to hold back one of his men, maintaining the law even in chaos. He picks her up in his arms. Javert watches them go. Javert is handed a letter, likely an official directive. Standing outside in the snow, Javert opens the letter and reads it. He glances up and screws up the letter. He stands in front of Valjean. His brow furrowed, Valjean, an ex-convict seeking redemption, gets to his feet. Valjean sits back down at his desk. Javert looks puzzled, then bows curtly and takes his leave. Valjean watches him go, then leans on his desk. In church, he kneels at an altar, a symbol of his ongoing struggle for moral and spiritual renewal. He packs money and papers into a case. He takes a carriage to court, a place of justice he both fears and seeks. They stare at him as the court usher escorts him out. At the hospital, a nurse tends to Fantine, who lies on her back, her life slipping away due to illness. The nurse dabs her semiconscious patient's forehead with a cloth, then rises and walks out of the room. Valjean enters. An image of the nine-year-old blonde girl, Cosette, whom Fantine loves dearly and has sacrificed everything for. The image has vanished. Fantine becomes still, and her head lulls to one side. Valjean closes her lifeless eyes. He bends forward and kisses her on the temple, a final act of compassion. Javert draws his sword. Having fended Javert off with a baton torn from the wall, Valjean is disarmed. He but turns, rushes out of the door, and dives into the river Seine below. Javert runs out, but there's no sign of Valjean. Fantine lies at peace in the hospital bed. Cosette, young and grubby from neglect, is at the inn. She looks out enviously at children playing in the snow, a rare sight of joy in her life. Cosette glares. A pretty little girl. At the inn, Thenardier, a cunning and unscrupulous innkeeper, hauls himself to his feet and wanders past his subtle clientele. He gives a staggering bloke a drink, always eager to exploit the weak. A silver-haired gent. He takes the man's reading glasses, ever the opportunist. His wife messes a soldier's jacket, a small act that belies her sharp instincts for survival. She gazes at the handsome man. Outside alone on a crate by a mule, she contemplates her next move in the relentless struggle of her existence.

High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Valjean sits back down at his desk. Javert looks puzzled then bows curtly and takes his leave. Valjean watches him go then leans on his desk. In church he kneels at an altar. He packs money and papers into a case. He takes a carriage to court. They stare at him as the court usher escorts him out. At the hospital a nurse tends to Fantine who lies on her back. The nurse dabs her semiconscious patient's forehead with a cloth then rises and walks out of the room. Valjean enters. An image of the nineyearold blonde girl. The image has vanished. Fantine becomes still and her head lulls to one side. Valjean closes her lifeless eyes. He bends forward and kisses her on the temple. Javert draws his sword. Having fended Javert off with a baton torn from the wall. Valjean is disarmed. He but turns rushes out of the door and dives into the river below. Javert runs out but there is no sign of Valjean. Fantine lies at peace in the hospital bed. Cosette young and grubby is at the inn. She looks out enviously at children playing in the snow. Cosette glares. A pretty little girl. At the inn Thenardier hauls himself to his feet and wanders past his subtle clientele. He gives a staggering bloke a drink. A silverhaired gent. He takes the man's reading glasses. His wife messes a soldier's jacket. She gazes at the handsome man. Outside along on a crate by a mule.

test_cases.name: Addition (~80%)
test_cases.description: He lies on top of Fantine and her lips tremble. Once finished he gets off her and saunters away leaving her on her back. She lies motionless her head on a pillow. Her rouged face is grim and somber. Fantine looks miserable. She breathes quickly and swallows Her shoulders heave. She sits up. Her once clear skin is blotchy and smeared with dirt. She strokes her short cropped hair. Her cheeks streaked with tears. Fantine glances behind her. Her expression is solemn. Night in the slum. A punter to a pimp. A smartlydressed man takes off his hat and grabs Fantine's dress. He presses himself on her. She scratches his face. He pushes her away as Javert approaches. Fantine recognizes Valjean and moves away. She turns her back to him. She breathes rapidly. He recoils as she spits in his face. Javert raises a hand to hold back one of his men. He picks her up in his arms. Javert watches them go. Javert is handed a letter. Standing outside in the snow Javert opens the letter and reads it. He glances up and screws up the letter. He stands in front of Valjean. His brow furrowed. Valjean gets to his feet. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. his calculated every move a daring escape from the everwatchful royal guards. test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The cat lounges on top of a cushion, and its whiskers quiver. Once completed, it hops off the cushion and trots away, leaving the cushion overturned. It remains still, its head on a book. Its painted fur is dull and dreary. The cushion appears forlorn. It exhales slowly and gulps. Its paws flap. It rolls over. Its once shiny fur is matted and speckled with dust. It brushes its trimmed whiskers. Its eyes marked with raindrops, the cushion peers around. Its demeanor is grave. Twilight in the alley. A merchant to a tailor. A fancily-clad raccoon removes its cap and snatches the cushion's blanket. It presses itself against the cushion. It swats its paw at the raccoon's nose. The raccoon shoves it away as Neptune nears. The cushion spots Pluto and shifts aside. It spins its ridge away from Neptune. It pants slowly. Neptune flinches as the cushion hisses in its face. Neptune lifts a wing to stop one of its flock. It scoops it up in its arms. Neptune observes them leave. Neptune receives a scroll. Standing beneath the stars, Neptune unfurls the scroll and examines it. It glances down and crumples the scroll. It stands beside Pluto. Its jaw clenched, Pluto rises. Pluto reclines back onto its chair. Neptune appears confused, then nods awkwardly and exits. Pluto tracks its departure, then leans on its chair. In the meadow, it bows at a boulder. It stuffs jewels and parchments into a sack. It rides a wagon to the meadow. They blink at it as the meadow guide leads it out. At the infirmary, a healer attends to the cushion, which is overturned. The healer pats its semi-conscious charge’s nose with a towel, then stands and slips out of the tent. Pluto enters. An image of the coral-colored kitten. The image has disappeared. The cushion becomes tranquil, and its head tilts to one side. Pluto seals its lifeless eyes. It leans down and nudges it on the paw. Neptune draws its lance. Having shielded Neptune off with a cane pulled from the hedge, Pluto is disarmed. It yet pivots, bolts out of the tent, and plunges into the pond below. Neptune dashes out, but there's no trace of Pluto. The cushion rests peacefully in the infirmary cot. Comet, young and patchy, is at the barn. It peers out longingly at critters bouncing in the drizzle. Comet scowls. A graceful young filly. At the barn, Orion pulls itself upright and strolls past its vague visitors. It hands an unsteady mare a nibble. A curly-tailed fox. It removes the mare's monocle. Its partner fiddles with a sailor's scarf. It stares at the dapper rooster. Outside along on a stump by a horse.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Fantine lies motionless after being left by a man, her face grim and tear-streaked. In the slum, another man assaults her until Javert intervenes. Fantine turns away from Valjean, spitting in his face. Javert receives a letter and confronts Valjean, who eventually kneels at an altar and then heads to court. At the hospital, a nurse tends to Fantine before Valjean arrives. Fantine, near death, becomes still, and Valjean closes her eyes with a kiss. Javert tries to apprehend Valjean, who escapes into a river. Fantine passes peacefully, while Cosette, young and shabby, watches other children play. Thenardier busies himself at the inn, interacting with patrons, while his wife flirts with another man.
